casebody.data:
DUKE ENERGY CAROLINAS, LLC, Plaintiff
v.
Herbert A. GRAY, Defendant/Third-Party Plaintiff
v.
John Wieland Homes and Neighborhoods of the Carolinas, Inc., Third-Party Defendant
and
Builder Support Services of the Carolinas, Inc. f/k/a John Wieland Homes And Neighborhoods of the Carolinas, Inc., Fourth-Party Plaintiff
v.
Yarbrough-Williams & Houle, Inc., Lucas-Forman, Inc., and Carter Land Surveyors & Planners, Inc., Fourth-Party Defendants. No. 108PA14-2. Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 10, 2015. Debbie W. Harden, Meredith J. McKee, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. John R. Buric, Preston O. Odom, III, Charlotte, for Gray, Herbert A. Fred W. DeVore, III, Charlotte, for Builder Support Services Of The Carolinas, Inc., et al. Erik M. Rosenwood, Charlotte, for Yarbrough-Williams & Houle, Inc. Lawrence J. Goldman, Charlotte, for Lucas-Forman, Inc. Gregory W. Brown, Raleigh, for Carter Land Surveyors & Planners, Inc. Matthew D. Rhoad, Davis F. Roach, Raleigh, for Piedmont Natural Gas Company, Inc., et al. Joseph W. Eason, D. Martin Warf, Raleigh, for N.C. Electric Membership Corporation, et al.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 6th of January 2015 by Plaintiff in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 10th of June 2015."

Therefore the case is docketed as of the date of this order's certification. Briefs of the respective parties shall be submitted to this Court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 15(g)(2).
